meanings.definition: To treat or impregnate with common salt.
meanings.sent1: The chef salinized the soup to enhance the flavor.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often salinize the soil to improve crop growth.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally salinized my coffee instead of sugaring it.
meanings.sent4: Her words were salinized with sarcasm, leaving a bitter taste in my mouth.
meanings.sent5: The ocean breeze carried the scent of salinized air, reminding me of childhood beach trips.

meanings.definition: To become impregnated with common salt.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the soil salinized due to excessive salt deposits.
meanings.sent2: The meat salinized as it sat in the brine solution.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn accidentally salinized itself when the salt shaker spilled.
meanings.sent4: His heart salinized with sorrow as he watched the sunset alone.
meanings.sent5: The old book had pages that were yellowed and salinized from years of exposure to sea air.
